unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain News: Vendor Audits Tightened Across Sectors**
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain News: Vendor Audits Tightened Across Sectors

unnormalised: Mumbai, India – Amidst growing concerns over quality and ethical sourcing, several manufacturing and supply chain firms are ramping up their vendor audit programs. Experts cite recent cases of substandard materials impacting production schedules and brand reputation as key drivers.
normalised: Mumbai, India – Amidst growing concerns over quality and ethical sourcing, several manufacturing and supply chain firms are ramping up their vendor audit programs. Experts cite recent cases of substandard materials impacting production schedules and brand reputation as key drivers.

unnormalised: Companies like Tata Steel and Mahindra & Mahindra are reportedly investing heavily in enhanced audit protocols, focusing on compliance with ISO standards and local regulations. These audits now include rigorous assessments of environmental practices and labor conditions in addition to quality control.

unnormalised: “We need to ensure that our supply chain partners adhere to the same high standards that we uphold ourselves,” stated Mr. Sharma, Head of Procurement at a leading automotive manufacturer. He added, “Especially during peak demand periods like the run-up to Diwali, when pressure on vendors increases.”

unnormalised: One key focus area is ensuring food safety and hygiene for employee canteens, especially during festivals like Onam when shared meals and special dishes like biryani are commonly prepared. Vendor audits are now frequently extended to include sanitation checks of canteen facilities, ensuring compliance with FSSAI guidelines. These proactive measures aim to minimize risks and foster a robust, reliable supply chain across the nation.
